content.question: Which of the following explains the role of interest groups in the iron triangle diagram?

choices.label: Interest groups pass public policies to benefit the industries that they represent.
Interest groups pass regulations and issue rulings on industries or groups.
Interest groups work with Congress and the bureaucracy to determine how best to regulate an industry.
Interest groups contact the bureaucracy on behalf of voters who need problems solved.

content.answer: Interest groups work with Congress and the bureaucracy to determine how best to regulate an industry.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how the argument or perspective in the source relates to political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
